runs.comm: turns in from outside off, pushed towards backward point .. overthrows ...  hmm the batsmen were not even looking for the run but its a wild throw at the non-striker's end
from round the stumps, turned to midwicket
spins down the leg side, past the attempted sweep
gets forward to push it to point
shout for lbw as spins in to beat the sweep shot .. umpire indicates it would have turned down leg
driven towards the non-striker and the bowler maeks a diving stop
leans forward to drive past the bowler
quickish, on the leg stump line, Barath tries to turn it to the on side, gets a leading edge to the off side of the pitch
on the middle and leg line, dabbed to short fine-leg
on the middle stump line, turns, pushed away to the off side
tossed full outside off, square driven to point
quicker, turns on the middle and off line, Barath goes for the drive and edges it to point. Price has a few things to say to the batsman
goes for a sweep shot but doesn't connect properly. Good over this.
sharp turn there .. from round the stumps, it spins away from the off stump line, Chanderpaul holds his bat inside the line
leans forward to defend t othe off side
gets forward to flick this one to midwicket
floated full around off stump, driven through the off side for couple of runs
just outside off, this one straightens, cut away to point

loud appeal for stumping. Smart work from Taibu. It was flighted loopy delivery just outside off, Chanders goes for the big sweep, misses and drags his back foot to on the line. Taibu whips the bails off, Chanderpaul tries to get his boot back, does he get some part behind the line or is it still on the line? That's the question for the third umpire. Not out is the verdict! That was really close.
leans forward to jab it to the off side
floated full outside off stump, Barath plays a fine square-drive to point boundary. Nice skillful strike there.
plays the sweep shot to get off the strike
turns in towards off stump line, dabbed to the on side
he leans across to fetch it from almost outside off stump and sweeps with the turn .. he sort of scooped it well clear of short fine-leg fielder
outside off stump, sort of holds its line, Chanderpaul punches inside the line and it runs off the outer edge to third man
takes two steps down the track, adjusts to the shortening of the legnt hand cuts to point
swings this one to deep midwicket
flighted just outside off stump, straightens, Chanderpaul pads it away
this one slips down the leg side
on the off stump line, chopped down to backward point
fuller and Chanderpaul drives to long-off
turns to middle stump line, cut to cover
turns to the off stump line, stops on the batsman, Chanders checks his punchy drive in the air but it drops short of the bowler
goes for the sweep but can't get it away
goes for the reverse sweep this time but doesn't connect properly
works this through midwicket
turns away from the off stump, pushed to point

Price gets the breakthrough. It drifted in from round the stumps, lands on the middle stump line, puff of dust goes up, grips the surface and turns ... Barath was down the track, looking for the big swing to the on side but couldn't get bat to ball and the off stump has been pegged back
Utseya tosses the ball up, Chanderpaul plays it uppishly towards cover
worked away towards square leg, West Indies think of a second, they decide against it but a misfield allows them to take it
takes a swipe across the line to an outside-off ball, misses
punched towards mid-on
watchfully defended off the front foot towards the off side
and that's another wicket for Zimbabwe, Fletcher goes for a duck, getting on one knee and sweeping the ball to deep square leg, can West Indies mess this up?
fullish ball on the pads, tucked towards square leg, Taylor dives full-length to his right to save that one
turns sharply after pitching on middle, runs away down the leg side, just about pulled back near the rope
an inside-edge sends the ball scurrying towards short fine leg
blocks this one more confidently, with the full face of the bat
fullish ball on middle, clipped towards midwicket, Pollard gets his first run
Chanderpaul gets forward and works the ball towards midwicket, straight at the fielder
this time Chanderpaul walks across and tucks the ball wide of the midwicket fielder for an easy single, that's the end of Price's spell
on the leg stump line, flicks the leg break to deep midwicket
pushes this one well down the leg side

Pollard has been sent back to the hut. What a game this is proving to be. Both sides trying to out do each other in self destruction. Puzzling but immense fun if you are an neutral! It was the flighted delivery on the off stump line, Pollard stretched out to play a big lofted drive but beaten by the dip and missed it completely. The ball went on straight to take out the off stump

OMG! . Cremer gets two in two. Chanderpaul stands alone. What's going on?! Lil Bravo goes for a big pull shot first ball but it keeps a touch low and skids on to hit him in the line of off stump. It might have missed off, it might have hit the outside half of the off stump.
leans forward to defend and keep out the hatrick delivery
gets forward to squeeze this to the on side
big googly this time, Ramdin is cramped going for the cut and jabs it to the on side

Dropped by Cremer at deep midwicket What a big big miss this. It could cost them the game in theory. It was a full toss , which was swung straight to Lamb but he made a complete mess of it. What a clanger!.
sharp turn this time, from round the stumps, the off break spins past the edge
full delivery, flicked away to square-leg
leans forward to defend to the off side
quicker one but turns down the leg side
turns from outside off stump, pushed out to cover
pretty full in length, on driven to long-on
on the middle and leg line, Ramdin backs away to cut to point
big turn there and it spins right past the outside edge ... Ramdin was completely squared-up there
turns this one to the leg side
skids on straight on the middle, clipped to midwicket for a quick single. .. Chanders makes it home in time to beat the direct hit. It was referred upstairs but easy decision to make
turns this from the middle and off line to square-leg
stays back to punch this to midwicket

Cremer, who dropped Chanders earlier, can breathe easy now. Chanderpaul is trapped in front. Lamb got this to go almost straight with the arm from round the stumps. Chanders was playing for the turn and pushed well outside the line and was hit in front of the off stump. What a big wicket this. West Indies slid deeper into trouble.
leans forward to defend to the off side
moves forward to defend
full delivery, pushed back to the bowler
outside off stump, Smith drives inside the line and is beaten
leans forward to on drive to long-on
leans well forward to defend and is hit on the pad justoutside the line of off stump by the googly
gets forward to drive it past the bowler
leans forward to ping the long-on
turns in from the leg stump line, dabbed to square-leg
stretches forward to drive to long-on
quicker slider, goes past the glance to hit the pad outside leg stump
on the middle stump line, Ramdin, who has looked pretty good out there so far, flicks it to deep midwicket
picks it from outside off and swings it to deep midwicket
sharp turn there again! Ramdin was backing away to cut and is cramped for room; he manages to jab it to the leg side
And again. Very risky attempt to play against the turn. As Matt Prior once said, never cut against the spin and pat a burning dog!
lovely .. this one goes on straight outside off, Ramdin is beaten, going for yet another cut shot
Maximum! Smith goes down on his knees to propose ... dispose it to the second tier in the stands beyond the midwicket boundary. The first boundary in more than ten overs!
leans forward to push it to the on side for a single
spins down the leg side , turned to left of short fine-leg fielder
stays back to clip it to midwicket for a single
moves back to punch this one to long-on
quickish on the off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
leans forward to flick it for a single

Raise a toast to Zimbabwe! They are doing this in style. What a game.  This one turns on the middle and leg line, Smith tries to sweep it finer but the ball goes off the edge to left of midwicket where Utseya takes a fine tumbling catch. And then they were 4. What a unbelievable state of affairs.
gets forward to flick it for a single
spins down the leg side for a wide
stays back to get it away fro a single
works it with the turn past square-leg
spins in, wristed away for a single
moves outside leg  and turns this to midwicket
spins towards the off stump line, Ramdin backs away again to cut it to deep point
moves well outside leg, Cremer follows him with a straight delivery, cut to backward point
slider on the leg stump line, clipped past square-leg
turns to the middle stump line, pushed away weakly back to the bowler

Surely, Zimbabwe have sewed this game now? Sammy moves down the track, tries to play for the turn but this one slides back in, goes through the bat and pad gap and hits the stumps. The pitch has turned, yes it has been a touch slow and stopped on the batsmen but the skill levels have been poor.
pushes this one back to Taylor
lobs a gentle full toss, mistimes the swing to deep midwicket
turns away from the off stump, and spins past the outside edge
fuller, straighter, driven to the off side
pretty full in length, tapped back to the bowler! They can't get it off the turf here.
Shout for stumping  and it's refered to third umpire Rampaul goes for the big swing but is beaten by the off break but has some part of his back foot just about inside the line
Slower one from the seamer - it has been all spin so far- ramdin backs away to mistime the flat-batted shot back to  the bowler
short of length outside off stump, Ramdin clears the front foot and plays a flat-bat forehand down the line to the long-off boundary
really full delivery, mistimes the drive to long-on
full and outside off, the batsman can't get bat on ball.
reaches out to stab the full delivery for a single ...
moves outside leg, drives to long-o n .. just a single ... 33 runs needed in the last over. Oh well ...
Dropped at long-on Ramdin heaved the full delivery straight to long-on where the fielder clangs it.
sprays this one down the off side
short in length, swatted away to the on side
low full toss on the leg stump line, Ramdin goes for the swing across the line and edges it to third man
yorker arrives now, squeezed out to point
leans forward to swat it away to deep midwicket. Final delivery coming up.

Zimbabwe have won it! Who would have thought this result was possible when they were struggling so badly at the start of the game and with all those ducks in their scorecard? They managed to crawl past 100 and what a comeback in the second half.  What a deliciously bizarre game this has been. btw .. this final delivery, a very full one, was pushed out by Rampaul. West Indies were brutally exposed by the spinners here. Quite an amazing turnaround.
